doc.name: Cylinder3D
doc.description: This actor contains the geometry and appearance specifications for a GR cylinder. The output port is used to connect this actor to the Java3D scene graph. This actor will only have meaning in the GR domain. Note that most of the parameters are described in the base class documentation.
doc.author: C. Fong, Adam Cataldo, Edward A. Lee
doc.property: The number of divisions in the circles forming the ends of the cylinder. This is an integer with default value "max(6, roundToInt(radius * 100))". This parameter determines the resolution of the cylinder, which is approximated as a surface composed of rectangular facets. Increasing this value makes the surface smoother, but also increases the cost of rendering.
The height of the cylinder. This is a double with default 0.7.
The number of divisions on the side of the cone. This is an integer with default value "1". This parameter probably only needs to change when the wireFrame option is set to true.
The radius of the cylinder. This is a double with default 0.5.
